channel.title: Clinical Notes on A Hugo website
channel.description: Recent content in Clinical Notes on A Hugo website

item.title: My clinical notes 1: a patients with lupus erythematosus
item.description: A 19-year-old, rural, skinny girl diagnosed with lupus erythematosus. Sometimes I met and talk with her in the ward. Some of our talking are very impressive to me, both reflect environmental and social issues. After I take notes on her symptoms, I still want to ask more things, even if I am not supposed to do. I am always interested in how does people get disease. The lupus erythematosus, why does this disease come to her.

item.title: Clinical notes: dementia caused by intracranial tuberculoma
item.description: Tuberculosis is not only a disease in respiratory systems, it can infect many organs, for example, osseous tuberculosis, Intra-abdominal Tuberculosis and central nervous system . I saw one case of intracranial tuberculoma during my observation in Dept.TB. The patient have kind of cognitive decline, and there is several seconds delay when he answer people’s questions, come to hospital because disability of one leg. Then he was diagnosed as intracranial tuberculosis with TB after CT and a series of serum test.

item.title: Many people only know ther syphilis when blood donation
item.description: At afternoon and I go to outpatient department, where I can talk and ask questions to the doctors when they are free. “Many people got syphilis and are not be aware of that, but it’s not a problem. Because nowadays, people take antibiotics often, you know, even for a cold. Tp. is so easy to be killed. Many patients found they were infected until they go to blood donation.”
